ResourceHeader.Description: The Hobart Ionosonde station near Hobart, Tasmania, Australia, has ionosondes since December 1945. They are IPS 4D between 02/1994 and 09/2001, IPS 5A between 01/1991 and 04/1997, CADI between 10/1998 and 02/2009, IPS 5D since 09/1998 to now. The ionosonde information before 01/1991 is not avaiable. The IPS 5D vertical sounding ionosondes normally sweep in frequency from about 1 to 21.5 MHz. Frequency step resolution for the 5D is 5kHz, with up to 4095 steps available. The step interval is variable, becoming more coarse at higher frequencies as ionograms are generally displayed on a logarithmic scale. See details at http://www.sws.bom.gov.au/World_Data_Centre/2/1/15
